Steps.Message: Hi, I'm Ebony and I am the manager of the text messaging team at UK Power Networks in Ipswich. Today's power cut was unexpected, so we were unable to provide you with prior notice to help you plan ahead. I am pleased to confirm that we managed to resolve this by diverting power to get your lights back on as soon as possible. Just so you know, we text customers when we are made aware of problems like this, so if you would like to be notified in the future you can do so here https://bit.ly/3zyHC6L. This was a widespread problem on the underground network and I personally apologise for any disruption this has caused to your day. If you have any questions or are still without power, please call us on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut today. Our staff have confirmed they have now diverted power around the underground cable fault and managed to restore power to the Margate CT9 3 area by approximately 08:20.

We apologise that this final update is delayed. After restoring supplies, our engineers first need to carry out essential safety tests before they are able to call us to confirm that everyone has been restored.

We're sorry for any disruption caused by this unexpected power cut, but if your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles. Sent by Simon at 09:19.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 09:11 - We want to reassure you that we've certainly not forgotten about you and we know that the estimated time frame has now passed. Getting you an update is our priority, as we know it's important that you have the latest information.

Our team on site are still working, and we are liaising with them to get a progress update to you as soon as we can safely do so. As soon as we hear from them we'll be in touch, or you can call us on 105 if you need any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 17:24 - Hi David here from the messaging team. I'm so sorry for how long you were without power for today. We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to 434 customers in the Newmarket Road area to safely repair a faulty piece of overhead electrical equipment.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi David here again. I'm so sorry that power is still off this afternoon and thanks for your patience today. We know a power cut can be difficult, especially in colder weather.

Many properties have gas hobs, which can still be used in a power cut for cooking, or heating water for drinks and sterilisation of baby bottles. The spark to ignite the hob will not work however, so if you do use it please take extra care when using other ignition sources like matches or lighters. Even in daytime, the light in your house may be low in a power cut, so only do this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always on hand to help.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 16:18 - Hi David here again. Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know that they have run into complications on site with the ongoing repairs to the faulty overhead electrical equipment which is hindering pour progress to be able to restore your power in the Newmarket Road area. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 17:30 and 18:30.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 17:29 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the Plurenden Road TN26 3 area should now be back on.

Following thorough tests at our substation and on local network equipment, our staff have been able to safely replace our network equipment. The suspected underground cabling issue is not yet appearing on any of our tests, so for the moment we have restored your power as quickly as possible.

I'm afraid this may happen again, but every time you lose power it gives us a better chance of pinpointing the problem. I'm sorry for the continued disruption, but If you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this evening. We want to be as transparent as possible as we know having multiple power cuts is disruptive and worrying, so I would like to help explain why we can't always fix a problem like this right away.

Underground electricity cabling is insulated for safety and if a fault develops, these materials can re-seal due to heat passing through them when our safety equipment operates and your power is lost. This covers any potential fault again, meaning our staff cannot locate it using their tests or specialist equipment.

We'll know more once our staff contact us again, so I'll be in touch again shortly.

Sent by Lee at 17:11.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
With darkness now upon us we understand that it can be unsettling to have a power cut. It may help to locate a torch and anything else you may need so you can have it to hand just in case.

If you have any concerns please do not hesitate to contact our team, but we will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible. Sent by Lee at 17:03.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 18:19 - Hi David here again. Our staff have now managed to restore power back to the Station Road area again.

They have thoroughly investigated our network equipment in the area, but the underlying network fault has not yet developed to a point for it to appear on any of their diagnostic tests. As such, they have replaced our substation equipment to restore power as quickly as possible.

I'm sorry this affected your power again today. This may happen again before we're able to pinpoint the issue and fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about anything or if your power isn't on, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by David at 17:48
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 17:39 - Just to let you know our staff have now arrived back on site in the Station Road area. They are going to test our equipment thoroughly to check if the underlying issue can be located before they attempt to restore your power again.

I know having power cuts this often must be causing you a lot of problems, and our staff are doing everything they can to keep the power on. Our estimated time frame is currently between 21:00 and 22:00, although this can be subject to change.

We're keeping in touch with our staff regularly to make sure you have the best information to plan ahead. I'll update you as soon as we hear more from them.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Lee at 18:46- Thank you for your patience while our engineers diverted the power around the fault on the underground network and cable that had came down in the Leigh, TN11 8 area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 18:31- Thanks for your patience over today; I'll be on hand to update you as our staff work on repairs, and I just wanted to give you the latest from site.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Lee from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I'm sorry for the power cut today; I know the lights going off can be disruptive.

We know that some customers affected by todays power cut may have had other issues recently, and I appreciate this is frustrating. High voltage cabling can cover a wide area, so sometimes properties very close to you may have had power cuts that you didn't experience.

I know you may not have had any previous power cuts, but if you have, we often get progress updates from our field staff management about investigations into repeat issues, and our Customer Services team will try to contact everyone affected by them to explain what's happening.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 22:05 - We can now confirm that all power in the Salmon Lane area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Salmon Lane area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to be testing if the network is still healthy.

They will start at the substation, and often apply specialist equipment that may turn your power back on for a brief period, so don't worry if your power comes on and goes off again. They will also check smaller sites which run along our cabling route, these break our network down into smaller sections and can help pinpoint any possible problems.

Our estimated time frame of 00:00 and 01:00 hasn't changed, so I'll let you know more once our staff update us. Sent by Lisa at 21:16.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 20:28 - Our staff are on the way to the Salmon Lane area, as our substation equipment has operated again. Our current estimated time frame to restore power is between 00:00 and 01:00, but this is based on our staff being able to restore your power by replacing the substation equipment.

As this has happened several times recently, it indicates a cabling fault. This may have reached a point where our safety equipment will not replace safely, meaning the fault has become visible. If this happens, we'll arrange further specialist teams to attend and repair it. I'll keep you updated.

MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV UG Network Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 30-DEC-2025 06:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Huntingdon PE28 0 area and are investigating the fault. You may find your power is going on and off; that is normal for this type of issue and is due to our engineers working to divert power remotely. By doing this, we've managed to restore power to 148 customers. There are now 155 properties still affected. We'll keep sending SMS updates until everybody is restored. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Sent by Kevin at 04:07.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Kevin at 03:23 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is on our overhead network that initially interrupted power to 303 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 242 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 04:30 and 05:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 02:44. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We're investigating a high voltage overhead electricity line fault which has caused a power cut in the local area.

Logs.Comment:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Huntingdon PE28 0 area and are investigating the fault.

You may find your power is going on and off; that is normal for this type of issue and is due to our engineers working to divert power remotely. By doing this, we've managed to restore power to 148 customers. There are now 155 properties still affected.

We'll keep sending SMS updates until everybody is restored. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Sent by Kevin at 04:07.

Sent by Kevin at 03:23 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is on our overhead network that initially interrupted power to 303 properties.

However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 242 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment.

We're currently estimating power will be on between 04:30 and 05:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find.

Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.

What will happen next?

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
